description: Borrowed from Latin cēnsus, from cēnseō. See censor.

nouns.description: census (countable and uncountable, plural censuses or censusses or census)

entries.meaning: An official count or enumeration of members of a population (not necessarily human), usually residents or citizens in a particular region, often done at regular intervals.

verbs.description: census (third-person singular simple present censuses or censusses, present participle censusing or censussing, simple past and past participle censused or censussed)
